alert.note: Alert for Boulder; Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 12:19PM MDT until June 02 at 1:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in north central Colorado, Larimer. In northeast Colorado, Boulder. * WHEN...Until 145 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1219 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Berthoud.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
